"Ah cah wah." Josh tried to say as he wiggled from Deb.
"Now, now, precious. Mommy knows you're hungry, if you're a good boy, you'll get milky when we come back." She cooed and pinched Josh's cheek as she laid him in his pram.
Josh tried sitting up but the hood didnt allow him to do so all the way. So he was forced to there and watch the hood of his pram, the rattle, sky as they got outside.
"Hes such a good boy." Deb told Mike, very proud the boy was slowly becoming used to being dependent.
"Are you coming Mike?"
11431121112121.title: Deb strolls you around the neighborhood

choices: Go with Michael to swim team practice
Stay with Deb, locked in your plastic pants
114311211121212.content:
"Oh course, Deb. I wouldn't want to leave you alone with this little stink bottom." Michael pinches Josh's cheeks. "Mommy will need Daddy's help if baby here makes another poopy." Just when Josh thinks he couldn't sink any lower he hears the sound of loud laughing. Josh turns to see Dan Frederick and Bob Puelo, 2 of Michael's swim teammates, laughing their ass at you.

"What are you doing? PLaying house?" Bob laughs

"Baby Joshy here needs a strong male role model, or he will never get out of those little sissy diapers." replied Michael.

"Dude, don;t you remember. We have practice this afternoon?"

"I totally spaced. So baby, should I take you with and we can make you our little baby mascot? Or should you stay with mommy. Of course I still have the key to your locking plastic panties, so you will have to sit in whatever you make until we get back to Deb's house. Your choice, junior."
114311211121212.title: they get stopped by Mikes friends.

Mike picks Josh up, and the three head to swim practice. "Hey genius, what are you gonna put him in during practice? Is he just gonna sit on the floor?" Bob asks. "No, dummy, I have a blanket for him. Shut up." Mike says, thwapping Bob on the back of the head. Bob rubs the injury, and punches Mike in the arm. Josh winces, and backs away. "Watch it, moron. I have a baby." Mike tells him. After a few more minutes of walking and the guys talking about classes they're gonna drop for next year, Josh begins to fall asleep. He snores softly, and his stomach gurgles. He opens his eyes, knowing what is about to happen. He begins to whine, making Mike look down. "Baby, what is it?" he asks. Josh sees that they are turning into the school entrance, and looks back at Mike. Unfortunately for Josh, he cannot hold it any longer, and he poops. He begins sobbing into Mike's shoulder. After he is done, Mike carries him quickly to the bathroom. He takes out changing supplies, and quickly changes him, all the while shushing the boy. After Josh is dressed, Mike picks him up, and sets him down near the sink. Mike washes his hands and disposes of the diaper. Josh begins crawling out of the bathroom, when Mike swoops down and scoops him up. "No no, we don't go anywhere without Daddy. You chose to be with me anyway, bub. Maybe you just need a nap." Mike says, carrying Josh to the pool. He sets up his blanket, and puts him down.

choices: Josh wakes up in his crib
Josh wakes up at Mike's house
11431121112121211.content: Mike takes a bottle out of the diaper bag and shakes it a little. He then picks up Josh and cradles him. "Open." he tells Josh, who complies. "Good boy." Mike says, as he begins feeding Josh the bottle. He watches as the boy's eyelids droop, getting heavier and heavier. Mike smirks, gently removing the bottle from Josh's mouth. Josh whines, and Mike shushes him. "Come on, burp for daddy." Mike tells Josh, patting his back. After a minute or so, Josh lets out a soft belch. "Okay, bub." Mike coos, laying Josh back down, pushing a pacifier into Josh's mouth. Josh sucks on the pacifier as he falls into a deep sleep. Mike gets up and continues with swim practice.
11431121112121211.title: Nap Time

choices: To his surprise, it's his real parents
114311211121212111.content: Just a short while ago he was a teenager, now Josh can barely recall how to feed himself, and slowly he's forgetting even basic independence. Now, hours later when he wakes up in a crib, he isn't worried, he dosent even yell. Instead he either sucks his thumb and waits like a good boy, or cry if no one comes. Josh didnt even need to speak words, Daddy Mike and Mama Deb knew just what he wanted. After he woke from his nap though, Josh started to fuss, just enough so someone comes and tends to him.
114311211121212111.title: Josh wakes up in his crib

1143112111212121112.content:
Josh looks up over the high rails of his crib, and sees his parents. "Hi, baby boy. Mommy and Daddy wanted to see how you were doing with your training program." his mom coos. Josh furrows his eyebrows, not understanding what she was talking about. Josh blows a bubble, and hears a soft chuckle. Deb walks into the nursery, smiling. "Oh, isn't this just precious? Looks like baby is coming along marvelously. Are you happy to see Mommy and Daddy?" Deb says. Josh does nothing. "Oh, does baby need someone to explain it to him? Ok. I run a program that allows parents to have their baby boy or girl back. It doesn't matter if they consent or not, the baby has no choice in the matter. You were rather difficult at first, wanting to be a big boy, but Mommy and Daddy paid me very nicely for this job. I couldn't pass up a fat paycheck." Deb says. Josh begin to cry, kicking his feet in displeasure. His dad picks him up, cradling him. "Oh, is my little baby boy upset. It's ok, pal. Daddy's here. Mommy and Daddy just need you to stay with Mama Deb for a few more days, and then you won't have any more big troubles. Mommy and Daddy will take care of you." he coos, rocking Josh. Josh does not calm down, upset by this stunning news. Deb takes out a bottle, which has been laced with sedatives, and shakes it to mix the formula. She hands the bottle to Josh's father, and he sits in a nearby rocking chair to feed his son. Josh looks up at him, and he has a small smile on his face. "That's my baby boy." he says softly. Josh's eyes close, and he drifts off to sleep. "Thank you so much, Deb. We can't thank you enough." Josh's mom says to Deb. "Well, just wait about a week or so, and he'll be just like a big infant." Deb replies. Josh's father hands Josh to Deb, and the parents head out. Deb changes Josh before putting him in his crib, wanting him to sleep comfortably. Deb walks downstairs to the living room, where Mike is sitting, watching tv. "Deb, have you ever thought that you're ruining kids lives by doing this?" he asks suddenly. Deb looks at him. "How do you mean?" Deb asks in return. "Well, for one thing, you're making teens revert into infants mentally, because their parents can't deal with the fact their precious angels are growing up. If you ask me, that's a violation of basic rights." Mike tells her. "I'm doing someone a job that not just anyone can do, Michael. I'm doing my clients a favor." Deb replies casually. "Clients? That's my next problem. You weasel money out of people, and for what? So that you can be up to your knees in some 16 year old's feces? Do you really want to take care of a 130 pound baby?" Mike says, glancing at Deb. "We'll discuss this later." Deb says stiffly, walking off.
Mike sits in the bathroom with Josh, urging the boy to use the toilet. Josh isn't having it. "Come on, Josh, I don' have all day. Deb will be home soon. If you want any chance at growing up again and getting away fro Deb, you can't be pooping your pants all day." Mike says. Josh, who is sitting on the toilet, his footie pajamas down, begins to cry. "Shhh, Josh, please stop." Mike tries, not waning to get caught. He hears the front door close, and Deb's voice rings through the house. Mike, worried he'll get punished, yanks Josh off of the toilet, and hikes his pajamas up, zipping them shut. "Mike, why is Josh crying? Didn't I ask you to put him down for his nap?" Dec calls from the kitchen. "Um, yeah! He was wet, so he started crying." Mike calls back. Mike picks up Josh, placing him on his hip. He makes a beeline for the door, but bumps into Deb. "Oh, come to Mama, my sweet baby. Hold on, why aren't you wearing a diaper?" Deb asks, becoming suspicious. "Umm, I was in the middle of changing his diaper." Mike replies, looking Deb anywhere but in the eyes. "So you just had to put his pajamas on, as if I had never seen him naked before?" Deb continues. "Um, not quite. We, uh, ran out of diapers." Mike lies. "And why were you changing him in the bathroom?" Deb asks. Mike shrugs. "And, Michael, I see a diaper right on the floor, next to the toilet. I know whose that is. Unless, you've started wearing diapers too?" Deb asks. 'Ok, this is getting out of hand. She knows something happened.' Mike thinks. He blushes. "Uh, you know me. Hehe, sometimes I just can't hold it. It's convenient." Mike says nervously. "Go wait in your room, young man. I'm going to take care of the baby. I'll deal with you once he's cozy in his crib, where he should have been for the last hour." Deb hisses. Josh cries out, and Deb carries him to his nursery, her voice going all maternal and mushy.
Mike sits on his bed, waiting for Deb to make her appearance. He can't believe how serious about this little "business" she started. It's been running for, maybe one year, and she's already gotten through with nineteen kids. Mike shudders to think what they've been through with her. The woman sure can be scary. Though, he already knows how power hungry she can get, having worked with her with ten of the kids, Josh being the eleventh. The door creaks, and Mike is pulled from his thoughts. "Michael, after all this time, you're trying to undo everything I've worked for, everything I'm giving to my clients? You never used to be this way, never fought with me or tried to hinder my progress. I can't have you blabbing to anyone, especially the police. So, will you do me the honor of being the twentieth baby in my program?" Deb says. "What?" Mike asks. Deb smiles maliciously. She lunges at Mike, who screams out. Deb puts a pacifier in his mouth, securing it around the back of his head, ensuring he can't spit it out. She makes quick work of stripping him down and diapering him. She wraps him tightly in a strong blanket, and picks him up. Once she has him in her grasp, she injects him with a strong sedative, rendering him unconscious in ten seconds. She smiles, and carries him downstairs. She opens the basement door, and descends the long flight of stairs. She turns on the light, revealing a hidden nursery, occupied by a changing table, rocking chair, and one incubator. Deb had used this particular nursery only about four times prior, and she certainly had no regrets about putting time and money into it. She rests Mike gently in the incubator, and leaves after turning on a baby monitor.
1143112111212121112.title: To his surprise, it's his real parents

11431121112121211121.content: The next morning, Deb goes down to the hidden nursery, carrying a warm bottle. She turns on the light, and approaches Mike's incubator. She pick him up, and carries him to the changing table. She unwraps him, and opens the cold diaper. She begins to wipe him clean, glad to see he is still out. He slowly opens his eyes, and sees Deb. "Good morning, baby boy. Mama's almost done." Deb coos. She rubs some cream on him, and tapes a fresh diaper on him. She swaddles him again, and picks him up. She carries him over to the rocking chair, and sits. "Open up." Deb says. Mike begins to cry, not wanting this to happen. Deb sticks the bottle in his mouth, and he sucks gently. "There's a good boy. We have a lot to do with you, but that can't begin until you're out of your infancy stage. That will take a week minimum, but if you fight Mama on this, it will take longer, and I can assure you that you will face nasty consequences for bad behavior." Deb explained. Mike's eyes conveyed terror. "I know this is a lot to take in, baby, but this next week, hopefully no longer, will give you plenty of time to rest and let Mama take care of you." Deb replied. Mike finished the bottle, and when Deb pulled the nipple out of his mouth, he began crying. Deb put him up to her shoulder, and burped him. She cradled him, shushing him. After we was calmer, Deb put his pacifier in his mouth. She swaddled him again, and put him back in his incubator. She left the nursery, turning on a baby monitor, and turning off the light. Mike lay there, cramped, crying. He was torn. Did he put up a fight, and suffer the consequences at Deb's cruel hand, or did he give in, swallow his dignity, and play baby to a woman he once trusted?
11431121112121211121.title: Mike goes into Deb's program

114311211121212111211.content: Mike decided he wasn't going to submit. He didn't want to be a baby! He wanted to be a young adult and help Josh get out of this madhouse. The poor kid didn't deserve this treatment; none of the kids ever did. Deb was cruel and had unusual ways of giving back to people. Mike knew he needed to get out of there. He just needed the best solution. He thought hard, trying to formulate his plan. Then, it clicked. If Deb wanted him to be an infant, he could do that. The less Deb thought he would be capable of, the more alone time he could probably earn. Mike started to cry, which was picked up on the cursed baby monitor. In just about five minutes, Deb came downstairs, ready to take care of Mike. He didn't want the crazy woman near him, but if this worked, he'd be out of there in no time. Deb picked him up, and carried him over to the rocking chair. "What's wrong, baby boy? Are you sleepy?" Deb cooed, trying to soothe Mike. He was beginning to tire from crying, and slowly stopped, letting Deb know he was better. "Ok, looks like someone needs to go back down for their nap." Deb said, putting Mike back down in the basinet. He didn't put up a fight, knowing he would be alone in this room in a couple minutes. Deb turned on his mobile, and left, shutting off the light. Mike looked to the hooded part of the basinet, where the baby monitor was secured. It was off. He moved around, loosening the blanket that bound him. As he was doing this, he heard footsteps descending the stairs. He stopped moving, and closed his eyes, steadying his breathing. The light turned back on, and the footsteps of Deb approached the basinet. "Looks like I forgot about this." she muttered vaguely. When Mike heard the flick of the baby monitor's on/off switch, he cringed, a small cry escaping his lips. "Shh, shush." Deb soothed, and Mike felt her slip a pacifier in his mouth. He cursed inside his head, frustrated. Deb smoothed his hair down lovingly, rubbing his forehead some with her index, middle, and ring fingers. Mike lay stone still, and sucked on the pacifier. After Deb left, he opened his eyes. He decided to work around the monitor, seeing if he could shut it off. He could. Mike sat up, and slid out of the loose blanket. He felt colder. Dressed in a onesie and diaper, he climbed out of the basinet, slowly ascending the stairs. He opened the door, and snuck to the front door. He was so close to freedom, he knew it. As he reached for the door, he felt a hand on his shoulder. He turned, horrified, to see Deb, a stern expression on her face. "Look at Mama's naughty boy. I believe a punishment is in order." she says, sending shivers down his spine. She gave Mike a choice between a spanking and an unknown punishment. "What will it be, baby boy?" she asked.
114311211121212111211.title: Put up a fight

choices: Mike stops fighting, it's not worth it
1143112111212121112111.content: Mike looked at Deb fearfully. He needed to stand his ground. He balled his fists, and glared at Deb. She chuckled. "Oh no, baby looks so threatening with his pinky in his mouth. What are you gonna do baby, attack Mama?" Deb said condescendingly. Mike's tough-guy facade crumbled. Deb wasn't scared of him. She saw him as a weak, helpless baby. She knew she had the upper hand; she always would. Mike's only option for a minimal punishment was to come forward. He chose the one he knew. He didn't want to risk getting worse than a spanking. He looked at his feet, sucking on his pacifier. "Come on, baby, Mama's waiting." Deb said firmly. Mike sighed deeply. "Spanking." he muttered. "What was that? Look at Mama when you're speaking to her." Deb said, putting her hand to her ear. Mike looked at her, and removed the pacifier from his mouth. "Spanking." he replied, defeated. "Ok, let's go." Deb told him. Just as he was about to follow her, she scooped him up, carrying him to the living room. She sat on the couch, putting Mike over her lap, tummy down. She began softly, increasing the power of each hit. Mike winced uncomfortably. By the time Deb reached 50, Mike was sobbing. "What do we say to Mama?" Deb asked, looking down at the poor boy. "Sorry Mama." Mike cried, tears streaming his face. Deb picked him up, and cradled him. "Hush, Mama's all done. You did a naughty thing, you needed to learn a lesson." Deb said. She carried Mike to the nursery, and put him down. "You will now remain in your infancy stage for two weeks. Then, if you're good, Mama will let you continue at partial dependence." Deb said, turning on the baby monitor. She gave Mike his pacifier, which he gladly accepted. Deb left, shutting off the lights. Mike fell into a troubled sleep.
1143112111212121112111.title: Spanking

choices: He climbs out of the crib (out of his headspace)
11431121112121211121111.content: Mike groggily opened his eyes the next morning. He looked around, and saw no sign of Deb. He smirked. Perfect. Maybe now he could make his escape. Just as Mike was about to climb out of the bassinet, he heard the door open, and footsteps descending the stairs. He stayed as still as a stone, lying flat on his back, lest he get caught in another escape attempt. He was soon greeted by the beaming face of Deb. "Good morning, little one." she cooed. Mike scowled slightly. Here goes another day with Deb treating him like an infant. "Okay, let's get you out of this yucky diaper and into a clean one." deb said, picking Mike up. No way. Mike wriggled from her grasp, and landed on his feet. He booked it up the stairs, clad in a yellow stained diaper, thick mittens, and thick booties with no traction. Turning into the kitchen, Mike ran about a foot further, when he slipped. He took a hard spill to the floor, landing on his stomach. Wincing, he tried to curl up into a less painful position. When Deb found him, his right cheek was on the cold floor, legs folded beneath him, arms at his sides, palms up, his butt sticking up in the air. Deb clucked her tongue. "Now now, that wouldn't have happened if you had stayed calm instead of fussing around." she said. A small smirk curled at the corners of her mouth. She picked Mike up. He whimpered, sniffling. Deb shushed him, carrying him downstairs. Upon laying him down on the changing table, she saw the killer red mark that covered most of his ribs, stopping at his waist and the bottom of his pectorals. "Oh, baby." Deb whispered. She felt bad for him, but he made the choice to run from her. Just as she began taking off the diaper, Mike began crying. "Shh, you're okay, baby boy." Deb cooed, changing Mike. Once she was done, she dressed Mike in a t shirt and sweatpants. "Mama's gonna take you to the hospital, just to make sure you didn't break anything. Be a good boy while we're out, okay?" Deb said. Mike nodded, his eyes bloodshot from crying. "Peggy!" Deb called. "Yeah, mom?" Peggy asked. "Can you babysit Josh? I need to take Mikey here to the hospital." Deb informed her. "Yes, mom." Peggy said. "Thank you, dear. I'll be back later. I love you." Deb said. She carried Mike outside, placing him in the passenger's seat. She got in the driver's seat, ignited the engine, and pulled out of the driveway. Peggy waved as her mom left, and turned. "Finally, she's gone." she said. Peggy walked upstairs, and turned into the nursery. Josh was sleeping peacefully. She turned on the mobile, and left after shutting off the light. The door closed, and Josh's eyes snapped open.
11431121112121211121111.title: Mike continues to fight Deb

choices: Deb takes Josh to the basement
114311211121212111211112.content: Josh looked around the nursery, sitting up. Why was he in this stupid crib? He looked to see the baby monitor was off, and the mobile was on. He climbed out of the crib, and spat out the pacifier. He assessed his current outfit, and scoffed. No way was he going to the police wearing a onesie and diaper. He snuck around the top floor, listening for Deb. Realizing she wasn't there at the moment, Josh had a silent celebration. He was cut short when he was picked up from behind. "What the hell?!" he cried. "Babies aren't supposed to talk like that, Josh." came the voice of Peggy. "I'm not a baby!" Josh screamed, flailing his limbs. Peggy's eyes widened as she put two and two together. "Uh oh." she mumbled. "Josh, have you come out of your headspace?" she asked, already knowing the answer. "What headspace? What are you talking about? Put me down, Peggy!" Josh cried, continuing to kick. "Josh, this is bad. We need to get you back in your headspace before mom gets back. She'll be so angry if she finds out you've resurfaced." Peggy says, fear conveyed in her tone. "Good! Let her be mad!" Josh yelled, face hot. "No, you don't get it. If she gets home and you're out of your headspace, she'll put you right back into the infancy stage." Peggy replied. Josh's heart sank. "No, I won't do it!" Josh said, eyes welling up. "Can you at least pretend you're still in headspace?" Peggy asked. "I don't wanna be a baby anymore." Josh wept. Peggy shifted him in her arms, rubbing his back. "Please? Save yourself the trouble. Just act like a baby, and you won't have to go through your infancy stage again." Peggy told him soothingly. "Okay." Josh sniffled. "Good. Let's go get you ready, baby boy." Peggy responded, carrying him back to his nursery. She lay him down on the changing table, and changed him into a clean diaper. Josh kept his eyes in a downward glance, submissive tears streaming down his pink cheeks. "You're doing so well, baby." Peggy cooed, kissing his forehead. After Josh was clean and in a onesie, Peggy carried him downstairs to give him a bottle. She got a text notification, informing her that Deb was a minute away. "Just drink your bottle and try togo to sleep. The best way to pretend you're in headspace is sleeping." Peggy told him. She fed Josh, and his eyes drooped closed. Deb walked in with Mike, a smile on her face. "Nothing's broken, but he'll have a pretty bad bruise. I'm going to put him to bed." Deb said. She trooped downstairs. Peggy smiled at Josh, who had briefly opened his eyes. Deb came back upstairs, and Josh closed his eyes again just in time. "Here, Peggy. I'll take him." Deb said. Peggy nodded, handing Josh to Deb. Deb carried him upstairs. The last thing Josh heard before he fell into REM sleep was Deb's voice. "I know you're out of headspace." she growled.
114311211121212111211112.title: He climbs out of the crib (out of his headspace)

1143112111212121112111121.content:
Deb carried Josh down to the basement nursery, and swaddled him. She set him down in the other bassinet, where she put a baby blue pacifier in his mouth. She took a syringe out of a drawer of the changing table, and injected a clear fluid into Mike's and Josh's arms. Now that they had the mobility of newborns, they would not be able to move well at all for a long time. Deb smirked wickedly, and headed upstairs. She saw Peggy in the living room, and walked up to her, arms crossed. "Peggy?" she started. "Yeah, mom?" Peggy asked casually. "How did Josh get out of his headspace?" Deb inquired. "I don't know. When I went check on him, he was sleeping, but a few minutes later, I caught him walking around. He must have just slipped out of it." Peggy replied honestly. Deb raised an eyebrow. "Let's just check that, shall we?" Deb said. Peggy froze. "How do you mean?" she asked. "I have cameras, darling. Don't you remember how serious mommy is about monitoring the babies in her care? Deb responded condescendingly. Peggy sat there, still as a statue. Deb grabbed her roughly by the arm, and marched her into her office. Deb sat down in the computer chair, keeping a tight grasp on her eldest's arm. Deb found what she was looking for, and grinned a cheshire grin. "So, you told Josh to pretend he was still in his headspace to save yourself? That's precious, dear." Deb said smoothly. "I was trying to keep him from going through infancy again, mom." Peggy replied defensively. "Well, since it seems you're more than willing to sabotage this arrangement I've mad with Josh's parents, I have to send you somewhere else so you can't interfere." Deb replied. "No, you're not. I need to make sure you don't screw up anyone else's lives." Peggy said. Deb sneered. "That's precious, darling. You're not staying here." Deb replied. She picked Peggy up harshly, and carried her over to a Josh's baby swing. She buckled her in. Peggy thrashed around, trying to escape. Deb clucked her tongue at her. "Looks like my baby girl is fussy." she cooed, pulling out a syringe. Peggy screamed, and thrashed more. Deb grabbed her jaw, and pulled her face close to her own. "You cut the shit. Mommy is going to do whatever has to be done to keep your fussy ass quiet." Deb growled. Peggy bit the fleshy pad of skin between Deb's thumb and index finger. Deb let out a shrill cry, clutching her wrist. She glared at Peggy. Fuming, she grabbed her forearm, and plunged the sharp needle into a vein, pushing down the plunger. Peggy went limp. "Now all we need to do is shut your little mouth." she told her snidely. Deb pulled a pacifier out of her pocket, and stuck it into Peggy's mouth. Peggy's eyes began welling with tears. "Aww, is the little baby upset? Don't worry, darling. Now you stay quiet. Mommy has a phone call to make regarding your new temporary guardian." Deb cooed patronizingly. Peggy whimpered, as a tear rolled down her cheek. Deb rose to her feet, and walked toward the kitchen. She turned her head to look over her shoulder at Peggy. "Or permanent." she said evilly. This upset Peggy more. The upset girl began crying pitifully. Deb smirked as she dialed a familiar number on the phone.
Half an hour later, Deb walked back into the living room, where Peggy was practically asleep in the swing. "Guess what, baby girl?" Deb cooed, causing Peggy to open her eyes. She let out a small whimper, and looked at her mother. "You're going to be staying at Daddy's while Mommy gets the boys back into headspace." Deb concluded. Daddy? That must be Deb's boyfriend. Peggy didn't like him very much. He was big and scary, and often talked down to her. Peggy began crying. "It's okay, darling. Let's go get you changed into a diaper and dress, then Mommy will take you to Daddy's." Deb said, picking her up. She carried her upstairs to her room, where she had moved all of Peggy's clothes and replaced them with adult-sized baby ones. Deb lay Peggy down on a towel on her bed, and put her in a diaper. Peggy still couldn't move, but if she could, she would have kicked Deb square in the face. Deb picked out a light pink onesie and frilly pink ankle socks, and carried them over to the bed. She dressed Peggy, who was still crying. After she was dressed, Deb set her in the middle of her bed, and set about packing a bag for Peggy. She packed enough onesies, footies, pacifiers, and socks. Deb grabbed Peggy, and carried her downstairs, into the kitchen. Deb packed two baby bottles for her, and closed the bag. "Come on, baby. Let's get you to Daddy's before it's past your bedtime. You look sleepy." Deb said. She didn't sound as angry as she was earlier, but Peggy still didn't like her tone; she was very condescending. Deb walked outside, and put Peggy in a carseat. She walked back to the front of the car, and drove a few miles to her boyfriend, Carl's house. Deb retrieved Peggy, and walked up to the front porch. She rang the doorbell, and Carl opened the door. "Hey, honey." Carl greeted. He was a seven-foot-tall behemoth of a man, with jet black hair, and a clean-shaven face. His piercing amber eyes demanded cooperation of those around him. He had a bass voice that flowed through the air as it kept a steady rhythm as it played the eardrums. Deb handed Peggy over to Carl. "Hello, baby girl." Carl said, the vibrations of his voice sending ripples along Peggy's back. "Thank you so much for taking Peggy. Somehow, Josh slipped out of his headspace, and I need to re-regress him. I should warn you, she's been fussy lately. If she acts up, just give her a shot, and put her down for a nap. And make sure she has her pacifier in unless she has a bottle. She likes to bite." Deb said, glaring at Peggy. Carl chuckled deeply. "Don't worry, Deb. I'm sure this little one will behave herself just fine. You just run on home and get some rest." Carl replied. "Okay. Goodnight." Deb said, walking back to her car. Carl shut the front door, and looked down at Peggy. Peggy began crying. Carl rubbed her back soothingly, shushing her. "Daddy's here, baby girl. No need to cry." he said in his low voice. He shifted Peggy, and saw her eyelids drooping. "I think it's time for night night." Carl cooed, carrying Peggy upstairs. He opened the door to a pink, fully furnished nursery. He set Peggy down on the changing table, making sure she was dry before putting her down for the night. She was, and Carl picked her back up. He set her down in the crib, cooing at her. He turned on both the baby monitor and the mobile. "Night night, baby girl. Daddy loves you." he said. He left the room, shutting off the light, closing the door.
1143112111212121112111121.title: Deb takes Josh to the basement

choices: Mike is returned to his parents as a "good boy", no longer a bully.
11431121112121211121112.content:

This won't take long." she assures you. She takes out a diaper, and opens it. "Ok, ready?" she asks. You nod. As you begin to take off your boxers, she pulls up the diaper on you. Your boxers are at your feet by the time the diaper is on your slim frame. You look into Peggy's eyes, and see them dancing with compassion. You smile at her, and she smiles back. "How are these so big?" you ask. "I got them in the geriatrics section." Peggy replies. She gives you a big light blue t-shirt. "And where'd you get this?" you ask. "It was dad's, but he left a long time ago." Peggy says, pain flashing across her face. "I'm sorry." you say, as you put on the shirt. A few second later, you catch her off guard; you pull her into a high, meaningful hug. A few minutes later, she slips out of you warm embrace. "Come on Josh." she says, as the two of you go downstairs. You follow her into the kitchen, where she pulls out a jar of applesauce, a cucumber, and a carton of milk. She cuts the cucumber into slices, and pours milk into a glass. She starts drinking it. "You want a snack?" she asks. You nod; she gives you the applesauce. "I know how much you love apples." she says, smiling. You smile, and begin eating the applesauce. Peggy picks up a cucumber slice, and begins munching on it. Then, Danielle walks in, putting her backpack on the floor. "Hi Peggy, hi Josh- Josh, what are you dressed like that?" she says, looking at you. You look at the eight year old, and then at Peggy. "Dani, Josh is just wearing a comfortable shirt, and that's ok." she says. "But, he's wearing a-" Danielle starts, cut off by her big sister. "Dani, do you want to wear what Josh is wearing?" Peggy asks the girl. She looks at her big sister with wide eyes, and runs upstairs. "Thanks, Peggy." you say. "No problem. Sometimes I dress Danielle like that anyway. She doesn't want anyone to know she likes playing house." Peggy says. "Oh, are you the mom, and she's the baby?" you ask. Peggy nods. Then, she signals you to follow her, and walks into the living room. You follow. She sits on the couch, and pats her lap. You are reluctant at first, but then sit on her lap. "You're light, Josh." she says, not that she should be surprised; you were really thin, but not unhealthily so. "Uh, thanks." you respond, not knowing what else to say. "It must be stressful, your parents leaving right as school's about to start. I'm sorry." she says. "I don't mind, really." you say. Peggy takes a bottle from the table beside her. "Peggy?" you ask. "It's ok, Josh, just drink your bottle." Peggy says softly, her voice maternal. Peggy puts the bottle in your mouth, and you begin to drink. You soon feel tired, and fall asleep. Peggy gently gets up, drags a playpen over, and places you i it. She cover you with a blanket, and puts the pacifier on a dummy clip, putting it in your mouth. She smiles, and pulls out her phone. She opens her texts, and reads her mom's latest messages.
'How is everything?'
'Is Danielle home yet?'
'Is Jessica sleeping?'
Peggy types back a few words:
'Baby Josh is sleeping in his playpen.'
Peggy waited a few minutes, and got a new message:
'Good. Thank you, Peggy; I'll be home later.'
Peggy looks back at you, and smiles.

And my boyfriend is coming over to help." Peggy explains in a sweet voice. She looks at you with those beautiful green eyes. She is so beautiful. But you are a baby. You didn't even know she had a boyfriend. So, she put you in your crib, and got ready for her boyfriend. Soon, the doorbell rang. It was her boyfriend. The two came upsrtairs. "Shawn, this is my baby brother." She said. "Oh my god, he's so cute." He says. The two leave the room. Peggy comes back a few minutes later, and picks you up. She goes to the kitchen, and gets you a bottle. Shawn is on the couch in the living room. Peggy carries you in, sits down, and feeds you. You resist. You know you're not a baby. You hate this. "Aww, what's wrong, little guy?" Shawn asked, flashing brilliant white teeth. Eventually, Peggy is able to feed you. You are embarrassed, but finish the bottle. Peggy burps you, and puts you in a playpen. Her and Shawn snuggle as they watch a movie. You are jealous. You start crying. Peggy picks you up. You cry into her shoulder. "Shawn, I'll be back. I have to put the baby to bed. He's cranky." Peggy says, as she takes you upsrtairs. She puts you in your crib, turns on the mobile and baby monitor, shuts off the light, and shuts the door. You wake up. You have a very full diaper. It is uncomfortable. You are carried to the changing table by...
1541.title: Wake up in a crib

15412.content: You look up as Shawn lays you down. You are very uncomfortable. Shawn opens your diaper and starts to change you. You squirm, crying, as he wipes you. "Hey, it's OK little guy." Shawn says. He puts a new diaper on thou and carries thou back downstairs. "Aw, there are my guys." Peggy says, loving seeing Shawn Bering so sweet to you. You cry and reach your arms out to Peggy, who takes you. She pats your bum, humming to you softly. This calms you down, being so close to a girl you love, even if she is taken.

1551.content:
"Well honey if you truly wish to leave my house, I am not going to stop you. But at least stay for a meal with me before you go. My daughters are all out and it would be a very lonely dinner if I had to eat alone. Won't you stay?" She asked.

You stop in your tracks and look back at her. She has a pleading look on her face that makes you feel like you can't say no. After a moment you blurt out "what are we having?"

"Oh wonderful honey!!! Thank you for staying. Dinner will be ready in about an hour", Deb says, ignoring your question.

You sit down on the couch and watch TV, and before you know it, Deb pops her head in the room saying "Dinner is ready pumpkin". You grimace hearing her call you pumpkin, but get up and walk into the kitchen. It turns out Deb has cooked...
1551.title: Deb offers to feed you before you leave

choices: Notice that your milk is in a bottle
15513.content:
As you walk into the kitchen and look at the table, you notice that instead of the nice meal you were expecting, there is just jars of baby food placed in front of your seat. You look over and notice that the other seat has a nice steak with fried potatoes in front of it. You walk over to the seat that has the steak at it, and begin to sit down until you hear Deb from behind you say "Nuh-uh-uh that is for me honey, you sit at the other spot".

"But Deb..." You say before she interrupts: "Oh honey you have been acting so much like a baby I figured what better to feed you with than baby food. Now sit down, its not so bad, trust me. I'll grab you a glass of milk to drink" She says, walking to the fridge.

You sit down and stare at the jars of baby food, before deciding to open one labeled mashed carrots. You twist open the jar and bring a spoonful into your mouth...IT WAS HORRIBLE! You begin to spit it out uncontrollably, messing up your shirt and making yourself look like a fool.

"Aw you eat like a baby too honey. Let me get you a bib" Deb says, walking over and beginning to put a bib around your neck.

"No Deb I don't need that" You say. "Honey you will wear this or I will just call your parents and make up a story about how bad you have been"

You decide to play it safe and with anger in your eyes, you watch as Deb ties a bib, with a rubber ducky sewn in, onto your neck. "Now that wasn't so bad" she says, sitting down beside you.
15513.title: "Deb why is there baby food on the table?"

155131.content:
Deb sits down next to you at the table, and places your milk next to you. As you glance over at it, you are in shock that it is in a baby bottle!

"What is this! The bib is one thing, but I am not a baby and will not be drinking milk out of a bottle!" You yell.

Deb gives you a slap behind your head and says "You will do as I say. Now you agreed to eat before you leave and you will finish every last bit of this"

You bring the bottle to your mouth and gulp down some of the milk...

Suddenly you blurt out "mama!"

info.brief_description: A boy goes to stay with his neighbor, only to find out he is the new baby!
info.description:
You go to stay at your neighbors house when your parents move to Europe for business. This is the story of what happened to you there.

Your neighbor's name is Deb, who has three daughters:

1. Jessica, 8 months old.
2. Danielle, 8 years old.
3. Peggy, 17 years old.

Please feel free to add anywhere you'd like!
